result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abraham J Scott appeared by video.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Abraham J Scott. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Court vacates dismissal made on the record yesterday. State has filed an amended complaint correcting error previously in complaint. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.

Return on warrant/Initial appearance on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner

DA's office filed amended complaint at request of court supervisor due to the fact that this charge was suppose to be a felony and the wrong statute was listed when the case was opened.  Case to be reviewed on 06-14-2022 at 1:30 pm.  Court dismissed previous complaint but did not vacate the warrant so the warrant is still active on this case.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abraham J Scott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Abraham J Scott. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State moves to orally amend repeater language, will file an amended complaint.
Defense moves to remove repeater.
State is in agreement.
BTC: Motion to dismiss repeater penalty granted. Court dismisses file, case needs to be reissued as a misd.
